Forecast a trained ESN

Source: R/ESN.R
forecast.ESN.Rd

Forecast a trained ESN.

# S3 method for ESN
forecast(object, new_data, specials = NULL, xreg = NULL, ...)

Arguments

object

An object of class ESN.

new_data

Forecast horizon (n-step ahead forecast)

specials

Currently not in use

xreg

A tsibble containing exogenous variables.

...

Currently not in use.

Value

An object of class fable.

Examples

library(tsibble)
library(fable)
AirPassengers %>%
as_tsibble() %>%
model("ESN" = ESN(value)) %>%
forecast(h = 18)
#> # A fable: 18 x 4 [1M]
#> # Key:     .model [1]
#>    .model    index      value .mean
#>    <chr>     <mth>     <dist> <dbl>
#>  1 ESN    1961 Jan N(444, NA)  444.

#>  3 ESN    1961 Mrz N(449, NA)  449.
#>  4 ESN    1961 Apr N(495, NA)  495.
#>  5 ESN    1961 Mai N(515, NA)  515.
#>  6 ESN    1961 Jun N(561, NA)  561.
#>  7 ESN    1961 Jul N(653, NA)  653.
#>  8 ESN    1961 Aug N(624, NA)  624.
#>  9 ESN    1961 Sep N(541, NA)  541.
#> 10 ESN    1961 Okt N(482, NA)  482.
#> 11 ESN    1961 Nov N(425, NA)  425.
#> 12 ESN    1961 Dez N(466, NA)  466.

#> 18 ESN    1962 Jun N(594, NA)  594.
